intro: Rubus insericatus subsp. adornatiformis, commonly known as the adorned raspberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Rubus genus, though it is less commonly cultivated than other raspberry varieties.
